required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Calorie-restricted Feeding in Large for Gestational Age Infants With Dysphagia
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Randomized Control of the Effectiveness of a Calorie-restricted Feeding in Large for Gestational Age Infants With Dysphagia

brief_summary.textblock: Large for Gestational Age (LGA) infants have excess fat-mass (FM) secondary to prolonged in utero exposure to an energy-rich environment. Our preliminary data suggest that excess FM can be associated dysphagia and it is a potential clinically modifiable therapeutic target to improve the oral feeding outcomes. The objective of this Aim is to determine the impact of a short-term calorie-restricted diet on body composition and oral feeding intake volumes in dysphagic LGA infants.

detailed_description.textblock: Eligible subjects will be enrolled into an innovative calorie-restricted feeding vs. the standard feeding approach for 2 weeks. The essential component of the calorie-restricted feeding will be a permissive feeding volume restriction to 110 ± 10 mL/kg/day without increasing the milk calorie density, whereas the standard feeding approach will include an oral feeding volume goal of 150 ± 10 mL/kg/day. Infants will receive either breast milk or formula feedings per the standard feeding protocols. The body composition of enrolled infants will be assessed by the Pea Pod system at baseline and at the study end Subjects will be followed for clinical and growth outcomes until NICU discharge and over the telephone until 6 months of age.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The sample size for this pilot study will be 30 with 15 infants randomized into each arm.
study_design_info.masking_description: The data analyzer will be masked to the allocation

primary_outcome.description: mean percentage of oral feeding intake over 2-weeks of study

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 year
secondary_outcome.description: time to reach independent oral feeding

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 year
secondary_outcome.description: Total days of NICU stay from admission to discharge assessed at the time of NICU discharge

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 year
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of infants with gastrostomy placement before NICU discharge

arm_group.description: Permissive feeding volume restriction to 110 ± 10 mL/kg/day without increasing the milk calorie density, for 2-weeks
The standard feeding approach will include an oral feeding volume goal of 150 ± 10 mL/kg/day during the 2-week study period

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- LGA infants with dysphagia born at ≥ 37 weeks gestation, with FM z-score > +1.0 in body composition
Exclusion Criteria:
- Infants on any respiratory support, videofluoroscopic swallow study (VFSS) demonstrating unsafe swallowing function, GI surgical conditions, significant neurological morbidities, and major congenital, genetic syndromes/anomalies
